title: Associate Director of Engineering
company_industry: Software Development
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 


* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than
 **420 million** 
 active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, with an impressive year-on-year growth
 
 with
 
 high profitability.
* Listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.



  





**We at The Search team** 
 are responsible for some of the most vital and impactful features of the Truecaller application. These include:
 


* Caller Identification: Identifying who is calling and making sure users can take educated decisions to pick up or not
* Spam Protection: Identifying and blocking spam numbers, calculating spam likelihood, and enhancing overall spam detection.
* Name Accuracy: Guaranteeing that users see the most accurate and reliable names associated with numbers.
* Fraud Protection: Developing and maintaining services to protect users from fraudulent calls and scams.



  





**As the Associate Director of Engineering for the Search team** 
 , you will lead cross-functional disciplines including Android, Backend, QA, and Data. You’ll provide strategic technical leadership and oversee the day-to-day management of the engineering team, while also partnering closely with the VP of Engineering to drive organization-wide engineering initiatives.
 



  





**The impact you will create:** 




* Manage and lead Android, Backend, QA, and data disciplines within the Search team.
* Provide technical leadership and guidance to the engineering team.
* Mentor and develop team members.
* Participate in strategic planning and decision-making for the engineering team (including conducting technical design reviews)
* Drive continuous improvement in processes and technologies.
* Collaborate closely with the business unit lead to align engineering initiatives with overall business objectives and strategies. This involves:
* Regular meetings to discuss progress, challenges, and upcoming priorities
* Jointly defining key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success
* Ensuring that engineering solutions meet the specific needs of the business unit
* Proactively identifying and addressing potential risks and dependencies
* Fostering a strong working relationship based on open communication and trust
* Collaborate closely with the VP of Engineering to identify and drive horizontal engineering initiatives that span multiple teams or departments. This may include:
* Establishing and promoting standard engineering practices and processes.
* Leading cross-functional projects to solve complex technical challenges.
* Identifying and implementing opportunities to leverage shared technologies and resources.
* Fostering a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing across engineering teams.
* Ensure high-quality software delivery and adherence to best practices.



  





**What you bring in:** 



* Proven leadership experience in managing and mentoring engineering teams, preferably in mobile app development.
* Strong technical background in backend systems (JVM-based or similar).
* Experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban) and ability to drive efficient development workflows.
* Solid understanding of mobile CI/CD pipelines and release management.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to collaborate across functions (Product, Design, DevOps).Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering high-quality software in a fast-paced environment.



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 



* Knowledge of performance optimization for Android applications.
* Experience with security best practices.
* Prior experience in hiring and scaling mobile engineering teams.



  





**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/** 




  





**Sounds like your dream job?** 




 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



  





**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




  





 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
 



  





**What we offer:** 



* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package** 
 : Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!



  





**Come as you are:** 




 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.**

title: Säkerhetskonsult inom Microsoft
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
Är du passionerad om cybersäkerhet och vill arbeta med de senaste teknologierna inom Microsofts ekosystem? Vill du vara en del av ett team där innovation, kompetens och gemenskap står i centrum? Då kan det här vara ditt nästa steg!
   

  

**Om rollen – Din chans att stärka cybersäkerheten i framkant! 🛡️**
 Som
 **Säkerhetskonsult inom Microsoft** 
 hos oss får du en
 **central roll i att hjälpa våra kunder skydda sina IT-miljöer** 
 . Du kommer att:
   

  

* Analysera och identifiera säkerhetsbehov hos våra kunder, med fokus på Microsofts ekosystem.
* Utforma och implementera säkerhetslösningar som skyddar mot dagens och morgondagens hot.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste trenderna och teknologierna inom cybersäkerhet.
* Samarbeta med olika team för att skapa säkra, effektiva och hållbara IT-lösningar.
* Utbilda och vägleda kunder i bästa praxis för en säker digital arbetsmiljö.


 Den här rollen är perfekt för dig som vill
 **kombinera teknisk expertis med strategiskt tänkande** 
 och samtidigt göra verklig skillnad för företag och organisationer! 🚀
   

  

**Vi söker dig som…**
* Har erfarenhet som konsult inom IT-säkerhet, gärna inom Microsofts ekosystem. ✅ Är kunnig inom identitetshantering, hotdetektering och säkerhetsarkitektur.
* Har erfarenhet av verktyg som Microsoft Defender, Sentinel, Entra ID (tidigare Azure AD) och liknande.
* Är en problemlösare som gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste säkerhetshoten.
* Har en god förståelse för både tekniska och organisatoriska säkerhetsutmaningar.
* Talar och skriver flytande svenska, för att det krävs i det dagliga arbetet.


**Vad vi erbjuder 💜**
**Flexibilitet** 
 – vi tror på balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

**Utvecklingsmöjligheter** 
 – utbildningar, certifieringar och nätverkande inom säkerhetsområdet.
   

  

**En inkluderande och engagerad företagskultur** 
 – vi tror på att ha kul på jobbet!
   

  

**Konkurrenskraftig lön och förmåner** 
 – för att du ska känna dig trygg och motiverad.
   

  

**Spännande projekt** 
 – jobba med ledande företag och organisationer i säkerhetskritiska miljöer.
   

  

**Vem är vi? 🤗**
 Vi är
 **B3 Cloud** 
 , en del av B3 Consulting Group – ett av Sveriges ledande konsultbolag. Vi hjälper våra kunder att bygga framtidens IT-miljöer genom modern molnteknik och cybersäkerhet. Vi är ett
 **team på cirka 40 experter inom moln och säkerhet** 
 , och vi älskar att samarbeta, utvecklas och lösa komplexa utmaningar tillsammans! 💡
   

  

**Om B3 Consulting Group**
*B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på* 
 tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.
   

  

*Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.*
 💌
 **Låter det spännande?** 
 Hör av dig! Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!

title: License Owner, Stockholm
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Passionate about football (soccer) AND about business? Stranger Soccer is expanding to key cities around the world. We are looking for a License Owner to open and operate the Stranger Soccer business in Stockholm.**
 This is not your traditional management job - it is truly built for someone that wants to own and operate their own business (that happens to make the world's greatest sport accessible to everyone). This role is ideally suited for an adventurous and football-passionate entrepreneur.
   

  

**Sounds Like You?**
 As a next step, please visit www.strangersoccer.com and particularly the section Bring Stranger Soccer to your City to learn more about this dynamic opportunity.
 **If it appears to be a fit, and you wish to learn more, please fill out the form there to officially express your interest.** 
 Be sure to download and explore the Stranger Soccer mobile app as well.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Bring the Stranger Soccer brand and business to life for the assigned city
* Recruit, train, and lead a small central team (2-3 persons) as well as a few freelance Official Hosts (game hosts) to kick off the operation
* Identify and secure prime slots at football venues to run Stranger Soccer games
* Engage in creative sales and marketing digital and hands-onto ensure that customers are introduced to the platform as a convenient and preferred way to play
* Oversee a schedule of games, ensuring customers are delighted with each game they play, and keep coming back for more
* Take advantage of the strong backing and direction of Singapore headquarters, where an operations and technology team is ready to support you.


**You should have**
* A passion for football, and a strong connection to your local football scene
* A business background, ideally in management and customer service
* An entrepreneurial background or spirit
* A commitment to owning, driving, and scaling the Stranger Soccer brand in the assigned market
* A hunger to succeed: financial compensation for this role will be proportionate to hard work, business acumen, and effectiveness.


**About Stranger Soccer**
 With 3.5 billion football enthusiasts in over 200 countries, football is the most popular sport in the world. But why don't more people play it? Stranger Soccer (www.strangersoccer.com) makes playing football as easy as going for a jog or to the gym. Browse dozens of games on its acclaimed Mobile App. Book a slot. Turn up and play.
   

  

 Incorporated in 2017, Stranger Soccer has quickly transformed the sports & recreation scene in Singapore. In a few short years, it has grown to be the #1-way people play football and futsal in the country, amassing tens of thousands of registered users purchasing thousands of slots every week. Whether you call it Fussball, Fútbol, Calcio, or anything else, the world now awaits.
   

  

**Our Mission**
 To make playing football as easy as going for a jog.
   

  

**Our Vision**
 A world in which playing football is as popular and widespread as watching football.
   

  

**Got what it takes?**
**We look forward to meeting you.**

title: IT-Project Manager
job_function: Project Management, Information Technology, and Consulting
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Vill du jobba med varierande uppdrag jämsides med de allra mest erfarna i IT-branschen?** 




  





 Midagon är en nordisk, oberoende verksamhets- och IT-konsultfirma specialiserad på att genomföra utmanande transformationsprojekt och program. Vi är över 200 anställda i Norden, varav närmare 100 befinner sig i Sverige. Vi driver uppdrag i både privat och offentlig sektor, åt stora globala aktörer såväl som nationella företag. Våra uppdrag varierar i storlek, men gemensamt är att vi hjälper våra kunder att lyckas med sina komplexa transformationer, där vi kan stoltsera med långa kundrelationer samt flertalet egna ramavtal.
 



  





 Våra erfarna konsulter har en bakgrund inom IT-transformation med fokus på bland annat verksamhetsutveckling, projekt- & programledning eller specialkompetens inom specifika ämnesområden. Hos oss hittar du de bästa av de bästa. Ett ypperligt kvitto är våra utmärkelser som DI Gasellföretag, Sveriges nöjdaste kunder (Radar), 8 års certifiering av ”Great place to work” samt Superföretag av Veckans affärer.
 



  





 Vill du också vara del av ett team av seniora konsulter, där avslappnad atmosfär går hand i hand med ett engagerat arbete och sund livsbalans?
 



  





**Din roll** 




 I denna roll leder du komplexa Affär- & IT transformationer i nära samarbete med våra eller kundens projektledare och verksamhetsutvecklare. Du driver och koordinerar projekt genom hela livscykeln – från behovsanalys och planering till implementering och överlämning. Med din expertis fungerar du som en oberoende rådgivare och säkerställer att kunden når sina affärsmål genom effektiva och hållbara IT-lösningar.
 



  





 Internt på Midagon blir du en del av ett team av seniora konsulter med bred erfarenhet inom IT-transformationer inom både IT-system, infrastruktur och digital transformation. Teamet har både djup teknisk förståelse och strategisk kompetens samt erfarenhet från olika branscher och teknologi plattformar, där samarbete och kunskapsutbyte är centrala delar av arbetet.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 




 Som person ser vi att du är utåtriktad, energisk och inspirerar din omgivning. Förutom att hantera utmanande och utvecklande uppdrag är du prestigelös och är gärna involverad i att utveckla våra kunder, kollegor och dig själv.
 



  





**Som person ser vi att du har:** 



* Har mångårig konsulterfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av IT-och verksamhetsrelaterade projekt och förändringsledning
* Hög förmåga av att leda och driva projekt i olika organisationsnivåer med ansvar för budget och rapportering till styrgrupper
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på både svenska och engelska



  





 För att trivas hos oss krävs kombination av entusiasm, pragmatism samt ett metodist tillvägagångssätt. Både ledarskaps- och projektledningserfarenhet är avgörande, liksom färdigheter inom förändringsledning.
 



 Om du brinner för ständig förändring, älskar att ta dig an komplexa utmaningar och genuint vill hjälpa kunder att realisera sina mål, då kan du vara rätt person för oss.
 



  





**Är du nyfiken?** 




 Läs gärna mer om oss och om Våra tidigare uppdrag, på hemsidan kan du också enkelt registrerar din ansökan. Har du ytterligare frågor eller funderingar, tveka inte att kontakta Martin Nilsson inom HR-& rekrytering på martin.nilsson@midagon.com / 070-2257833 eller vår Head of people and culture, Hanna Fredriksson på hanna.fredriksson@midagon.com / 076-0074551.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Information Security Officer to the Stockholm School of Economics
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
The Information Security Officer (ISO) at the Stockholm School of Economics (SSE) plays a key role in strengthening SSE’s information security posture across research, education, and administration. This is a developmental position, ideal for a technically skilled security professional ready to step into a broader role that blends governance, risk management, and operational leadership.
   

  

 You will be instrumental in shaping how SSE manages digital risks, supports compliance, and secures data and systems in a hybrid IT environment. You’ll work closely with IT, researchers, administration, and leadership, building your strategic capability while still engaging with the day-to-day security operations.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A collaborative and innovative work environment
* The chance to work at a prestigious institution with a global reputation


**Responsibilities**
* Develop and oversee the implementation of the organization’s information security strategy.
* Establish and enforce security policies, standards, and procedures.
* Assist in performing risk assessments, maintaining a security risk register, and following up on mitigation plans.
* Help ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and frameworks (e.g., GDPR, ISO 27001, NIS2).
* Serve as the primary point of contact for security audits and regulatory inquiries.
* Be a point of contact for everyday security questions from departments and teams.
* Work with vendors and project leads to support third-party risk management.
* Manage incident response planning and execution.
* Promote a culture of security awareness across the organization.


**Your profile** 
**Requirements**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Security, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 2–4 years of experience in technical or operational security, e.g., as an Information Security Specialist, Systems Administrator with security responsibilities, or similar.
* Familiarity with risk management, GDPR, and frameworks like ISO 27001 or NIST.
* Strong communication and documentation skills in English (Swedish is a plus).
* A desire to grow into a more strategic, leadership-oriented role over time.


**Meritorious**
* Exposure to higher education or research environments.
* Experience with Microsoft 365 security tools (e.g., Defender, Purview, Entra ID).
* Ongoing or completed certifications such as CISSP, CISM, ISO 27001 Lead Implementer, or CompTIA Security+.


**About Stockholm School of Economics**

title: Senior Technical Consultant – Healthcare Informatics Solutions
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
**Job Title**
 Senior Technical Consultant – Healthcare Informatics Solutions
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a
 **Senior Technical Consultant** 
 , you are responsible for following defined procedures and methodologies to install, configure, test, maintain, and support hardware and software solutions.
   

  

 You collaborate with a variety of customers across Europe to conceptualize, design, and optimize Philips solutions, with the goal of ensuring customer success.
   

  

**Your role:**
* Scope, design, build, deploy, and integrate ICCA solutions tailored to customer needs.
* Fulfill software implementation deliverables, including detailed design documentation, system build, configuration, and testing.
* Analyze customer requirements to provide technical recommendations, mentor and train customers, resolve technical issues, and offer proactive technical support.
* Contribute to Philips' global knowledge sharing initiatives, assess repeatable processes, practice strong configuration management and version control, and drive continuous improvements based on customer feedback.
* Be a key member of the implementation project and service team, promoting collaboration and representing Philips professionally in both customer-facing and internal situations.


**You're the ideal candidate if:**
* You hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, along with relevant certifications and licenses.
* You have over 5 years of experience in a similar role, preferably with expertise in the healthcare sector.
* You possess strong communication skills in English and Swedish - is a must have
* You are willing to work flexibly, with a combination of remote working, onsite activity within the Nordics, and occasional European travel


**This is a Field role.** 
 Field roles are most effectively done outside of the company’s main facilities, generally at the customers’ or suppliers’ locations.
   

  

**About Philips**
 We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.
   

  

* Learn more about our business.
* Discover our rich and exciting history.
* Learn more about our purpose.


 If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

title: IoT Network and Roaming Solution Manager
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Job Title: IoT Network and Roaming Solution Manager** 




**Location: Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid)** 




**Job Type: Fixed Term Contract (1 year)** 




  





**Job description** 




  





 As the IoT Roaming and Network Technologies Architect , you will be responsible for ensuring that roaming
 



 and network capabilities align with the strategic goals for IoT connectivity across various countries. Acting as a
 



 bridge between the IoT platform team and internal technology groups, your role includes defining,
 



 communicating, and overseeing the implementation of network and interface requirements. Your primary
 



 responsibility will be to ensure that requirements are accurately defined, clearly communicated, coordinated
 



 across stakeholders and correctly implemented.
 



 Key Responsibilities:
 



 1. Solution Design and Technical Leadership
 



 o Oversee the design, implementation, and ongoing maintenance of IoT roaming and network
 



 technology solutions, ensuring alignment with business objectives and customer
 



 requirements
 



 o Ensure seamless integration with mobile network interfaces such as provisioning, RADIUS,
 



 GX, GY, probe XDRs and offline CDRs.
 



 o Ensure that backhaul services are scoped and delivered in a way that meets solution
 



 requirements and market expectations.
 



  





 2. Network capability management
 



 o Oversee the implementation and maintenance of IoT specific functions and configurations in
 



 the mobile network.
 



 o Ensure compatibility and sufficient performance of mobile network functions which are
 



 affected by the IoT subscribers
 



  





 3. Interface Management:
 



 o Oversee the implementation and maintenance of interfaces to the mobile network.
 



 o Ensure compatibility and sufficient performance of provisioning systems, RADIUS servers,
 



 GX/GY interfaces, and offline CDR processing and their integration to the BSS systems for IoT
 



 connectivity.
 



  





 4. Tool Development and Management:
 



 o Identify, develop, and implement tools for controlling and monitoring of the IoT connections
 



 network services.
 



 o Ensure tools are scalable and adaptable to future network service requirements.
 



 5. Collaboration and Communication:
 



 o Work closely with cross-functional teams including network operations, IT, and business
 



 units.
 



 o Collaborate in a team that gathers the IoT connectivity knowledge within the group.
 



 o Communicate technical requirements and solutions effectively to stakeholders.
 



 o Coordinate with delivery teams and stakeholders to ensure smooth and timely execution of
 



 defined requirements
 



  





 Skills and Qualifications:
 



  





 o Technical Expertise: Strong knowledge of mobile network technologies, IoT, and related
 



 interfaces (provisioning, RADIUS, GX, GY, CDRs).
 



 o Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze complex technical problems and develop effective
 



 solutions.
 



 o Project Management: Experience in managing large-scale technical projects.
 



 o Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 



 o Adaptability: Ability to stay updated with the latest technological advancements and adapt
 



 strategies accordingly.

title: Verksamhetsutvecklare inom företagsbeskattning
company_industry: Government Administration
description:
Vill du arbeta på en stor spännande myndighet, där du kan bidra till ett väl fungerande samhälle för privatpersoner och företag? Som verksamhetsutvecklare inom företagsbeskattning kommer du att vara med och skapa rätt förutsättningar.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som verksamhetsutvecklare arbetar du i olika utvecklingsprojekt som följer processen för verksamhetsutveckling. Rollen omfattar mycket samverkan, såväl inom utvecklingsenheten som med it-avdelningen, rättsavdelningen samt våra operativa enheter. Exempel på arbetsuppgifter en verksamhetsutvecklare har är att vara metodstöd och förändringsledare.
   

  

 Du kommer arbeta i en organisation och inom ett område där du tillsammans med ditt team stöttar i såväl tillämpning av befintlig lagstiftning som i framtagandet av ny.
   

  

 Som verksamhetsutvecklare arbetar du i ett team tillsammans med kollegor företetagsbeskattningsavdelningens utvecklingsenhet. Rollen omfattar mycket samverkan med ditt eget och andra team och givetvis med den operativa verksamheten. Vidare arbetar du nära dina kollegor och du delar med dig och tar till dig av ny kunskap. Vi arbetar i hög grad virtuellt genom Skype. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du ska ha balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

 Du tillhör utvecklingsenheten på företagsbeskattningsavdelningen med placering i Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha ett intresse och kunskap kring utveckling och förändring
* ha en helhetssyn med förmåga att se hur verksamhetens olika delar påverkar varandra
* vara lösningsorienterad och har förmåga att se olika perspektiv på frågor
* föredra att arbeta i team med ett gemensamt uppdrag och gemensamma mål men också kunna agera självständigt
* tala och skriva enkelt och tydligt samt ha en tydlig pedagogisk förmåga
* vara stabil och trygg som person.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* högskoleutbildning om minst 180 hp (120 p) alternativt flerårig aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av kvalificerat arbete inom Skatteverkets beskattningsverksamhet
* aktuell flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av tjänsteutveckling inom företagsbeskattning
* erfarenhet av projektledning och samordning
* erfarenhet av arbete som specialist inom beskattning, t ex som lärare eller särskilt kvalificerad beslutsfattare
* erfarenhet av arbete med informationssäkerhet
* insikt i IT- och systemutveckling.


**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/487 | Kontakt: Kennet Mattsson, sektionschef 010-5767227, Jesper Österberg, hr-specialist rekrytering 010-5750245, | Facklig företrädare: Mattias Qvist, SACO 010-5787047, Marcus Adler, ST 010-5747012, | Publicerat: 2025-05-26 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-30

title: Release Manager
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
Hi all,
   

  

 We are hunting for Release Manager to our reputed customer in Sweden - Stockholm.
   

  

 About ITIVE AB:
   

  

 ITIVE AB, founded in 2019 and headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, is a leading IT consulting firm offering a wide range of customer-centric services. Our offerings include IT staffing and permanent placement, IT management, system development, infrastructure, ERP systems, quality assurance, IT security and Non -IT .
   

  

 Job Overview:
   

  

 As a release manager for ECOM platforms for all Brands within the retail group you are the overall responsible person for the wellbeing of releases. You have multiple stakeholders that you collaborate with and communicate with when needed. The release manager is the focal point between the business teams, site management, developing product teams, tech enablement and application operations
   

  

 Task that is included (but not excluded to) in the work of a release manager:
   

  

* Create overall release timelines together with relevant stakeholders (business,
* site management, application operation, product area leads)
* Align with operations on overall deployment activities, requests and timings
* Secure release progress and wellbeing
* Take immediate actions if the release is not going as planned
* Communicate release status status to stakeholders
* Facilitate internal Go/No go meetings prior to Common Go/No go meeting
* Participate in H&M common Go/No go decision and represent ECOM
* Facilitate Cross Release forum with SAP
* Prepare and organize Defect walkthrough
* Ownership of Release retro
* Monitor release on TGL night
* Monitor PGLS phase after release
* Improvements of release process (future state of release mgnt)


**Requirements**
* Self propelled doer
* An understanding of our technical landscape and its roadmap as well as how BT is organized and operates
* Dare to challenge our ways of working to make it better
* Good communicator
* Problem solver


 Personal Competences
   

  

* Ability to understand and analyze complex information and share it in effective and powerful communications
* Ability to understand people psychology and to connect to people to encourage new behaviors
* Ability to take responsibility, work proactively and continuously improve activities in complex, quickly transforming environments.


 If you are a highly motivated and talented individual with a passion for Release Management, we want to hear from you! Join our exciting journey to deliver innovative solutions to our clients. We offer competitive salary and benefits packages, as well as opportunities for growth and development within the client company. Apply now and take the next step in your career as a Release Manager with us.

title: Head of Software Asset Management
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 The Head of Software Asset Management (SAM) is responsible for leading the SAM function within EIT Core Operations. This role ensures efficient software asset and license management, compliance with regulatory and contractual obligations, risk mitigation, and cost optimization. The Senior Manager will drive governance, automation, and strategic alignment with business objectives.
   

  

**What you will do:**
**Strategic & Governance Leadership**
* Define and execute a SAM strategy aligned with the organization’s IT and business goals.
* Establish and enforce governance frameworks, policies, and best practices for software asset and license management.
* Collaborate with IT Security, Sourcing, Finance, and Legal teams to ensure compliance with contractual, security, and regulatory requirements.


**Software Asset & License Management**
* Oversee end-to-end software lifecycle management (Request, procurement, deployment, maintain, and retirement).
* Manage vendor audits and ensure compliance with licensing agreements.
* Implement and optimize license models (subscription-based, perpetual, SaaS, etc.) to maximize cost efficiency.
* Drive effective SAM tooling for inventory, monitoring, and reporting.


**Risk & Compliance Management**
* Mitigate risks associated with software non-compliance, Entitlement and ELP breaches.
* Ensure adherence to IT security policies related to software assets.
* Maintain a proactive approach to software vulnerability and risk management.


**Financial Optimization & Cost Management**
* Identify cost-saving opportunities through software license optimization, re-harvesting, and contract negotiations.
* Ensure software spend aligns with business value and ROI expectations.
* Work with Finance and Sourcing to develop software budget forecasts and cost reduction strategies.


**Stakeholder Engagement & Team Leadership**
* Lead and mentor the SAM team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development.
* Collaborate with BA/PA/MA, and vendors to ensure alignment of software investments with business needs.
* Partner with SW LCM and Product teams to drive efficient software governance.


**The skills you bring:**
* Education: Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in IT, Computer Science, Business Administration, or related field.


* Experience:
+ At least 15+ years of leadership experience and 7+IT Asset Management (ITAM) / SAM with leadership experience.
+ Strong knowledge of SAM frameworks (ISO 19770, ITIL, etc.).
+ Experience with SAM tools (Flexera, ServiceNow SAM, Snow, etc.).
+ Proven track record in vendor management, contract negotiation, software audit handling and stakeholder management.
+ Familiarity with cloud and hybrid licensing models (AWS, Azure, SaaS, etc.).


**Key Competencies & Skills:**
* Strong understanding of IT infrastructure, security, and compliance.
* Analytical and problem-solving skills for software optimization and risk mitigation.
* Excellent stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration.
* Ability to drive automation, intelligent operations, and process efficiency.
* Strategic mindset with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 India (IN) || Gurgaon, Noida, Bangalore, Kolkata, Chennai & Pune; Romania || Bucharest ; Sweden || Stockholm

 765953

title: Senior Infrastructure Cloud Architect, Professional Services
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
**Description**
 As a Senior Cloud Infrastructure Architect, you will contribute with presales and led complex projects as a Delivery Technical Leader, often involving multiple Amazon and customer teams. You will lead and enable them by applying Amazon Day 1 culture and developing technical expertise to deliver solutions tailored to their business needs.
   

  

 You will work with customers and partners supporting them through planning, prioritization and delivery of complex transformation initiatives, while collaborating with relevant Sales and Service Teams. You will help create and apply frameworks, methods, best practices and artifacts that deliver prescriptive guidance to customers, and publish and present them in large forums and across various media platforms. You will provide guidance regarding customers’ technical architecture and investments, maximizing alignment with the AWS platform, and ease of adoption as new services and products become available. You will work towards customer business outcomes, ensuring there is a strong connection between delivery activities and business objectives.
   

  

 Do you have experience leading and delivering large IT solutions in agile environment - plan, organize, and manage all phases of a project lifecycle to ensure successful delivery on a scale?
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Multiple years of IT implementation experience in customer-facing roles
* Track record as technical leader driving engagements and guiding customer investment decisions
* Experience driving discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation
* Experience driving presales with senior customer stakeholders in collaboration with internal teams
* Hands-on programming/scripting experience to drive the design, development and deployment of business software infrastructure at scale


**Preferred Qualifications**
* BS level technical degree with Computer Science or Math background
* Proven track record of implementing AWS services in large scale cloud migrations and highly available and fault-tolerant enterprise software deployments
* Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (e.g., security, privacy, SOX, ISO, HIPAA etc.)
* AWS Certifications, e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)

title: Senior Researcher
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this Opportunity:**
 This full-time position is based in Stockholm, Sweden, within Ericsson Research's ConsumerLab team, part of the Research Area Consumer & IndustryLab. Our small but diverse organization is driven by curiosity and a commitment to shaping a sustainable, connected future by understanding the needs and challenges of consumers, industries, and society. The Senior Researcher will lead critical research to understand the business, consumer, market, and traffic implications of 6G network technology. In this role, you’ll turn market and business insights into actionable guidance for network-technology development and customer-facing monetization strategies. Monitor XR, AI, emerging devices and core-connectivity ecosystems to identify upcoming opportunities. This position is highly visible within Ericsson and offers direct interaction and collaboration with leading global tech players and telecom operators. More details about Ericsson Consumerlab research available at ConsumerLab - unique insights on market and consumer trends
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Combine consumer/market insights with technical insights to identify monetization opportunities for core connectivity and platform business.
* Blend analytical expertise with strategic decision-making to uncover high-value business use cases for next-gen network technologies.
* Develop clear and engaging narratives around complex research findings, translating insights into actionable business recommendations.
* Leverage deep market, business and user-experience insights to identify novel technology and product concepts, collaborate with researchers to shape these ideas into defensible, patentable inventions, and draft clear, comprehensive invention disclosures that align with IP strategy.
* Create high-impact reports, presentations, and executive summaries for key stakeholders.
* Lead presentations to internal teams, senior leadership, and external audiences, effectively communicating research outcomes.


**The skills you bring:**
* Minimum 8 years of experience in insights, analytics, or research-focused roles.
* Strong background in driving applied consumer and business insights within a corporate environment at leading research or consumer‐insights consultancies or in equivalent in‐house insight teams.
* Proven track record designing and executing custom quantitative and qualitative studies (surveys, focus groups, ethnographies, online communities) across multiple markets
* Experience in the ICT, telecom, or technology sector in roles related to business analysis, strategy consulting, market/business intelligence, or research.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets.
* Experience in storyboarding and translating data insights into business narratives.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Working knowledge of statistical and scripting tools (e.g. SPSS, Python, R)
* Working knowledge of business-intelligence and visualization platforms (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
* A Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Behavioral Economics, Engineering, Telecommunications)


**Application**
 We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-the office.
   

  

 Last day to apply is 9th June 2025. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Lovina Rebeiro, Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner at lovina.rebeiro@ericsson.com
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: OSS/BSS Transformation Expert Architect
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
*Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues both locally and around the world, reimagining what’s possible. In this role you will be part of building Public Safety & Critical Communications with deep expertise in telecom, connectivity, and mission-critical communications. We develop tailored applications and manage complex integrations to maximize the potential of technology. Join us and collaborate with the world's leading organizations to realize the full value of technology through innovative solutions.*
**The Role**
 As an OSS/BSS Transformation Expert Architect you will be responsible for driving the end-to-end solutions for telecom service providers, focusing on transforming their OSS (Operations Support Systems) and BSS (Business Support Systems). This role requires deep technical expertise and strategic vision to deliver scalable, efficient, and innovative solutions that align with business objectives and emerging telecom trends. Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Solution Architecture & Design: Develop comprehensive OSS/BSS transformation architectures; define integration strategies; recommend tools and technologies.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Align transformation goals with business objectives; lead workshops and design reviews; bridge business and technical teams.
* Program Execution: Oversee project design and implementation; ensure timely, budget-friendly delivery; monitor risks and dependencies.
* Technology Expertise: Stay updated on telecom technologies; guide teams in adopting modern architectures.
* Process Optimization: Identify system gaps; propose efficient processes; leverage industry frameworks.
* Governance & Compliance: Ensure architectural governance; align with regulatory requirements; define KPIs and SLAs.
* Innovation & Strategy: Define OSS/BSS evolution roadmaps; recommend cost-reduction and customer experience improvement strategies.


**Your profile**
* Years of Experience: 12+ years in telecom domain, with at least 5 years in OSS/BSS transformation projects.
* Industry Exposure: Experience working with Tier-1/Tier-2 telecom operators or vendors.
* Technical Expertise: Extensive OSS/BSS experience; strong knowledge of telecom protocols and standards; proficiency in integration patterns.
* Architecture Skills: Ability to design scalable architectures; experience with cloud-native solutions; proficiency in architectural tools.
* Leadership & Communication: Strong leadership; excellent communication and presentation skills; ability to manage conflicts.
* Business Acumen: Understanding of telecom business models; ability to link technical solutions to business outcomes; experience in preparing business cases.
* Education & Certification: Bachelor's or Master’s degree in relevant fields; certifications like TM Forum, TOGAF, AWS/Azure, ITIL.
* You will be required to pass through SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which is a condition of undertaking the role


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies in the telecom industry, including professional certifications in telecom technologies and BSS/OSS platforms
* Our Values: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Europe North Public Sector Leader, AGS
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
**Description**
 The Head of Public Sector is a senior leadership team role in Europe North, responsible for all operations of the AWS Public Sector business across the eleven countries of the Nordics, Benelux and Baltics. They are responsible for leading a multi-country, multi-layer organization of sales, technical and business development professionals who deliver compelling value propositions that drive cloud adoption across all government, education, healthcare, nonprofit organizations, and state-owned enterprises in the region.
   

  

 This manager of managers role reports to the Europe North Managing Director, and is responsible for end-to-end ownership of our strategy, go-to-market, and execution in the AWS public sector business for the region. The right candidate will be able to engage at the highest levels of government and will possess strong influencing and communication skills, with the business acument to navigate a highly complex regulator landscape across countries of different maturity.
   

  

 This role provides an opportunity to impact, engage, shape, bring innovation and grow the adoption of cloud computing within the public sector for the greater benefit of society and these countries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 The ideal candidate will possess a senior customer leadership background that enables them to lead a diverse team of global sales leaders, customer account managers, partner and technical resources, engaging the broad public sector team.
   

  

 You will have the responsibility of mentoring and supporting the team so that pipeline and revenue quotas are achieved as well as defining territories and go-to-market strategy. Our growth will also mean that you will play an integral part with the growth and recruitment into the team.
   

  

* Develop strategic plans, set goals and quotas
* Hire and develop a multi-layer, multi-function orgnization, bringing in and cultivating the best talent in the industry
* Accelerate customer adoption and customer satisfaction, engaging at C-level or equivalent
* Work strategically with partners to extend AWS reach
* Collaborate with Senior Management, Finance, HR, Sales Operations, Sales Specialists, Marketing to align the team’s initiatives.
* Conduct regular reviews of business and performance including pipeline reviews, prospecting and closing deals
* Present regular, accurate reports to senior management for review
* Identify and drive program and business improvement on a regular basis


 We are also open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
   

  

* Amsterdam, Netherlands
* Stockholm, Sweden


 The successful candidate needs to be able to travel across the Europe North countries.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Successful experience leading in a matrix environment across multiple countries
* People/sales management direct experience in a multi-tiered organization and experience managing technology-related sales teams with direct quota responsibility
* Direct and indirect sales experience in working with European public sector organizations (Government, Education, Healthcare)
* Experience successfully building and executing go-to market plans for medium and large enterprise accounts, leading, motivating and developing talent. Full Professional English level and any Europe-North languages is a plus
* Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation and analytical skills, accurate and concise reporting


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Extensive knowledge of AWS products and services
* A technical or educational background in engineering, computer science, or MIS
* MBA/MS degree in relevant field
* 50%+ Travel Time


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers.
