 Job ID: A2931024

title: Founder Residency
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**About** 




  





 Ready to build your startup and get funded in 10 weeks? We’re a global early-stage VC backing founders from day zero. We invest up to €400k through our founder residency – a building sprint where you leverage community, sparring, and intense effort to make 1 year of progress in 10 weeks.
 



  





 Join the next Nordics residency starting
 **September 1st, 2025** 
 . Build your company alongside a cohort of pre-vetted, exceptional potential co-founders, validate your ideas, engage with customers, develop your MVP, refine your business model, and create your go-to-market strategy before pitching to the investment committee.
 



  





**About You:** 




 We are looking for
 **Founders, CEOs, CTOs, and others** 
 eager to build the next disruptive tech venture from the ground up.
 


* **Founder DNA:** 
 The residency is built for fully-committed, full-time entrepreneurs (or will go full time by the point of the residency). You know what it means to be a founder and are ready to take it on for the right reasons. Grit, integrity, determination, commitment, humility, and resilience describe you.
* **Experience** 
 : Successful Antler Founders have a honed skill in addition to Founder DNA. Examples include sales, software development, product design, domain expertise, fundraising, etc. Many worked at startups as founders or employees in the past.
* **Industry Focus:** 
 Antler is industry agnostic, as seen in our portfolio of investments. Antler has invested in over 1,500+ companies to date across many industries. In the Nordics, we have an active portfolio size of >150 companies that is well-balanced across different sectors.



  





**The Antler Founder Residency:** 




 The residency starts on
 **September 1st, 2025,** 
 and runs for
 **10 weeks in Stockholm** 
 . Any adjustments have to be agreed to in the interview process.
 



 Our residency program is fairly unstructured, with 90%+ of the time focused dedicated to founders working on their companies and making week-over-week progress. Here are some examples of things that founders focus on, depending on where they are at in their company journey:
 



  




* Find and vet potential cofounders
* Validate core assumptions around your business ideas and find meaningful market insight
* Build prototypes, find design partners, launch pilots, close customers
* Get feedback from functional experts and dedicated coaches
* Reach milestones that align with pre-seed funding



  





 If founders have already accomplished any of the above, they dedicate their full effort on the next most important milestones.
 



  





**Antler Investment Process** 



* At the end of the 10-week residency, you will have the opportunity to present to the Antler Investment Committee. If approved by the investment committee, you will receive a pre-seed commitment of
 **€400,000** 
 in two tranches. €100k for 10% and €300k in follow-on capital.
* Companies that receive investment at the end of the residency will join the Antler portfolio and gain even higher touch programming from our partners. This includes access our network of downstream investors, integration into the Antler Nordics portfolio and global portfolio network, and introductions to relevant partners and discounted service providers.



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is a early-stage VC that is changing the way people build companies. We operate in 30 locations worldwide, have supported 8,000+ founders through our residencies, and invested in 1500+ startups globally. We launched Antler to build a better on-ramp to venture capital. After working in venture-backed companies for years, we built Antler to provide founders with a structured and transparent process to successfully launch a new venture, a community for support throughout the experience, and a clear pathway to venture funding.
 



  





**Antler Highlights:** 




 Some examples of successful companies that were built as a result of Antler’s residency, received pre-seed investment from Antler, and have gone on to raise substantial investments are as follows:
 


* **Airalo:** 
 The world’s first eSIM subscription and top-up store
* **Wingbits** 
 : Incentive-based flight tracking platform
* **Treyd:** 
 Working capital operating system for B2B
* **Reebelo:** 
 Used electronics marketplace
* **Telgea:** 
 Global telecom operator
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software for identifying the best solar sites faster



  





**Cohort starts: September 1st, 2025 but we work with founders all year around on an ad hoc basis.** 




  





**APPLY NOW**

title: Serviceledare till HSB Stockholms hyresfastigheter
company_industry: Real Estate
description:
****VILL DU FORTSÄTTA UTVECKLAS SOM SERVICELEDARE? VI SÖKER DIG SOM KAN FASTIGHETSSKÖTSEL, HAR ETT PERSONLIGT ENGAGEMANG, DRIVS AV NY TEKNIK, KUNDFOKUS OCH SERVICE - OCH SOM VILL JOBBA MED ATT MÖTA MÄNNISKOR DÄR DE BOR.****
 HSB Stockholms hyresrättsbestånd uppgår idag till ett 70-tal fastigheter med ca 4000 lägenheter utspritt geografiskt i Stockholmskommuner. I rollen som Serviceledare för HSB Stockholm Hyresfastigheter kommer du att arbetsleda och stötta ett sammansvetsat team om 10 fastighetsskötare. Nära samarbete med områdeschef och samverkan med andra kollegor så som fastighetsförvaltare och administratörer är också en viktig del i rollen.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 I rollen kommer du att hantera sedvanliga arbetsuppgifter för en fastighetsskötare men du har också ansvar för den dagliga driften i fastigheterna samt arbetsledning och stöttning av fastighetsskötarna. I rollen ingår inte personalansvar.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara ett stöd till fastighetsskötare vid avstämningar och diverse uppkommande frågeställningar samt vara behjälplig vid återrapportering i befintligt affärssystem. Du kommer hantera arbetsorder och arbeta med problemlösning och felanalys i felavhjälpande underhåll. Du kommer att göra uppföljningar av både kund- och leverantörsavtal. Rollen innebär avrop, bevakning och kontroll av leverantörer och entreprenörer avseende uppdrag, pris och kvalitet. Du kommer att genomföra och följa upp egenkontroll/status av fastigheter samt planera och följa upp arbetsplatsmöten.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har arbetat inom ett tekniskt yrke där du haft en ledande roll
* Har arbetat med fastighetsskötsel
* Behärskar svenska i tal och skrift
* Har god förmåga att använda dig av digitala verktyg
* Innehar B-körkort


 Du har ett starkt teknikintresse, är praktiskt lagd med goda IT-kunskaper.
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 För att lyckas i rollen som serviceledare ska du vara ekonomiskt sinnad och kunna se affärer. Du ska även vara självgående, ansvarsfull och kunna delegera arbetsuppgifter på ett tydligt, strukturerat och pedagogiskt sätt till fastighetsskötarna. Vi ser gärna att du är lugn, stabil och serviceinriktad i ditt arbetssätt och att du är en lagspelare som har en bra förmåga att hjälpa andra.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med 6 månaders provanställning, och startdatum bestäms gemensamt. Du utgår från vårat baskontor i Solna men rollen innebär att du vistas i våra fastigheter och reser däremellan med servicebil.
   

  

 HSB Stockholm erbjuder en arbetsmiljö med fokus på din utveckling och ger en grundlig introduktion för att du ska få en stark start. Vi prioriterar din tillväxt och erbjuder både utbildning och stöd, så att du kan nå din fulla potential. Våra värderingar, ETHOS: Engagemang, Trygghet, Hållbarhet, Omtanke och Samverkan, genomsyrar allt vi gör.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en trygg och inspirerande arbetsplats där medarbetarna känner sig sedda och uppskattade. Våra medarbetare beskriver oss som en plats med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter, stöd från kollegor och en stabil grund av ansvar och förtroende. Hos oss arbetar du självständigt mot tydliga mål med stöd av specialister och en stark kompetensbas. Vi värdesätter mångfald och en positiv arbetsmiljö.
   

  

 Förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag och arbetstidsbank erbjuder flexibilitet i arbetslivet, och våra moderna kontor skapar en trivsam arbetsmiljö. Du har också möjlighet att bli HSB-ledamot i en av våra medlemsföreningar, vilket ger extra engagemang i vår verksamhet.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till vårt team och skapa en stimulerande arbetsmiljö tillsammans!
   

  

**Låter detta som något för dig?** 
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Vi gör urval löpande varför du gärna får skicka din ansökan redan idag.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Områdeschef Fredrik Gatemo; 0104421651
   

  

 Vi utför bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidat som en viktig del av våra rekryteringsprocesser. Vi vill betona att vi genomför dessa kontroller i full överensstämmelse med tillämpliga lagar, regler och GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation).
   

  

 Kanske är det just du som flyttar in hos oss!
   

  

**OM HSB STOCKHOLM**
 HSB Stockholm är den största av landets 24 regionala HSB-föreningar. Varje dag jobbar omkring 488 medarbetare med att leverera marknadens bästa medlems- och förvaltningstjänster åt våra viktiga ägare - våra 182 000 medlemmar. Vårt tjänsteerbjudande är brett och innefattar nyproducerade bostadsrätter, hyresrätter, bosparande och medlemskap för bostadsrättsföreningar och individuella medlemmar. Vi erbjuder också förvaltningstjänster och tjänster inom fastighetsutveckling för både bostadsrättsföreningar och privata fastighetsägare.
   

  

**HÅLLBARHET I VÅRT DNA**
 Hållbarhet är en av våra kärnvärderingar och ska genomsyra allt vi gör. Och vi menar allvar. För fjärde året i rad är HSB branschvinnare i Sustainable Brand Index, Europas största varumärkesstudie om hållbarhet. För oss betyder hållbarhet allt från mångfald och vår klimatpåverkan till socialt ansvarstagande. Vi arbetar med hållbarhet ur ett socialt, ekonomiskt och ekologiskt perspektiv. HSB har i 100 år varit en viktig samhällsaktör som bidragit till ett hållbart och inkluderande samhälle. Det vill vi fortsätta att göra.
   

  

**ATTRAKTIV ARBETSGIVARE**
 Vi erbjuder våra medarbetare en trygg anställning då vi är medlem i Fastigo, fastighetsbranschens arbetsgivarorganisation. Vi är stolta över utmärkelser som;
   

  

* Excellent arbetsgivare som ett av branschens mest jämställda företag via Nyckeltalsinstitutet
* Arbetsmiljöfrågorna är viktiga för oss, vi är därför sedan 2021 arbetsmiljöcertifierade.


 Hos oss på HSB Stockholm genomsyras allt av vår värdegrund ETHOS (engagemang, trygghet, hållbarhet, omtanke och samverkan) vilket syns tydligt i våra medarbetarundersökningar med höga ledarskaps- och engagemangsindex.

title: Idrottsplatsarbetare till idrottsanläggningar, Solna stad
company_industry: Government Administration
description:
**Om oss**
 Till Solna stads Drift enheten inom Idrott och anläggning söker vi nu två idrottsplatsarbetare på deltid till våra idrottsanläggningar. Driftområdet omfattar bland annat Ulriksdals IP och Skytteholms IP, Ulriksdals IP är huvudanläggning för isar och Skytteholms IP är huvudanläggning för fotboll. Verksamheten bedrivs året runt med uppvärmda fotbollsplaner och konstfrusna isbanor. Idrottsanläggningarna används till största delen av Solnas skolor och föreningsliv.
   

  

**Vad innebär arbetet?**
 Idrotten spelar en viktig roll för stora grupper av barn, ungdomar och vuxna. Tillgången till väl fungerande idrottsanläggningar är avgörande för genomförandet av träningar och matcher. Som Idrottsplatsarbetare i Solna möter du föreningsledare och idrottare som tävlar i de högsta svenska serierna, barn och ungdomar som just börjat med sin idrott samt alla föräldrar och andra besökare till idrottsplatserna. Arbetet innebär att ge alla dessa kunder och besökare bästa möjliga förutsättningar inom givna ekonomiska ramar, att ge bra service och ett gott bemötande för att bidra till att våra Idrottsanläggningar är trygga och trevliga mötesplatser.
   

  

 Du bidrar aktivt i arbetet och planeringen och i den dagliga driften, underhållet och skötseln av både is- och fotbollsanläggningar. I arbetet ingår bland annat att städa och att utföra regelbunden isvård och skötsel av konstgräsplaner. Vidare ingår vissa underhållsåtgärder såsom fastighetsskötsel, snöröjning och maskinarbeten. Arbetet sker med hög säkerhet för att minimera eventuella risker. I arbetet förekommer tunga lyft.
   

  

**Tjänstgöringen sker främst under kvällar och helger men även dagtid förekommer.**
**Vem söker vi efter?**
 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

* en gymnasieutbildning
* B-körkort är ett krav
* god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* goda IT-kunskaper för att kunna hantera den mångfald av tekniska system som finns på idrottsplatserna (ventilation, värmepumpar, kylmaskiner med mera).


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har
   

  

* tidigare erfarenhet av service och bemötande, barn och ungdomar
* kunskaper inom isläggning/isvård, konstgrässkötsel samt erfarenhet av att köra traktor och ismaskin.


 Som Idrottsplatsarbetare har du intresse för och god insikt i hur en idrottsplats och hur föreningslivet fungerar. Det är viktigt att du ser värdet av dialog inom teamet och med besökare vilket ställer krav på samarbete och din kommunikativa förmåga. Du förhåller dig på ett sätt som är anpassat efter situationen och löser konflikter på ett konstruktivt sätt. Vi arbetar för att våra idrottsplatser och anläggningar ska vara trygga mötesplatser och rollen kräver därför att du är bra på att möte människor och har god erfarenhet av service och bemötande.
   

  

 Du behöver även kunna arbeta självständig genom att fatta egna beslut och vara flexibel.
   

  

**Mer information och ansökan**
 Vi söker två Idrottsplatsarbetare, tjänsten är 50% tillsvidareanställning. Om du har några frågor är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Driftchef Amra Skaljo Lundberg på amra.skaljolundberg@solna.se
   

  

 Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan med CV
 **senast 8 juni 2025** 
 . Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vårt rekryteringssystem.
   

  

 I Solna arbetar engagerade medarbetare med uppdraget att utveckla staden och välfärden med solnaborna i fokus. Detta gör oss till en spännande och utvecklande organisation att arbeta inom.
   

  

 Förvaltningen för arbetsmarknad, kultur och fritid rustar Solnabor för jobb genom att erbjuda vuxenutbildning, svenska för invandrare, coachning och jobbmatchning. Under vårt paraply ligger också näringslivsfrågor där vi arbetar för att förbättra förutsättningarna för företag och företagare. Vi ansvarar också för skötsel och drift av idrottsplatser, bad och idrottshallar samt för Solna kulturskola och stadens bibliotek. Även stadens mötesplatser för unga ligger inom vårt ansvarsområde samt stöd till föreningar och studieförbund. Vi värnar och utvecklar stadens kulturhistoriskt värdefulla miljöer och förbättrar stadens rum med konstnärlig utsmyckning. Vi strävar alltid efter ett attraktivt utbud, med prioritering för barn och ungdomar.
   

  

 Solna är en framtidsstad i tillväxt, unikt belägen mellan Kungliga nationalstadsparkens lugn och storstadens puls. Vår vision är att Solna ska vara en levande och trygg stad, som förenar hållbar utveckling med en god ekonomisk hushållning för att trygga framtidens välfärd. Här finns attraktiva bostäder, framgångsrika företag, utmärkta kommunikationer, förstklassig samhällsservice och ett rikt kultur- och idrottsutbud. Solna stad är nu inne i en spännande utvecklingsfas, befolkningen växer och många företag söker sig hit.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: deltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 50% | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/244 | Publicerat: 2025-05-26 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-06-08

title: Engagement Manager , ProServe EMEA North
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a highly skilled and versatile Engagement Manager (EM) to join our team and lead the delivery of complex cloud solution projects. In this role you will combine technical expertise with strong project leadership skills to drive successful implementations of AWS-based solutions for our clients. You will bridge business requirements with technical solutions, facilitating technical discussions and ensuring alignment with customer outcomes. Applying AWS frameworks like Well-Architected and Cloud Adoption Framework while demonstrating technical credibility across diverse stakeholders, you will distill customer needs into clear technical requirements, decompose complex problems, and make informed trade-off decisions considering performance, scalability, security, and business impact.
   

  

 Possessing strong technology and program/project management experience, you will validate technical solutions against business goals, recognize when additional technical evaluation is needed, and manage technical risks. You will be expected to achieve and maintain relevant AWS certifications, develop domain-specific expertise, and effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and business audiences. As you progress, you’ll lead increasingly complex technical projects, shape cross-organizational technical strategies, and establish best practices in your domain. In this role you will apply your management and leadership capabilities to successfully execute project plans, proactively identify and manage risks, resolve issues, escalate when appropriate, and drive projects to successful completion, while exceeding customer expectation
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology program/project manager, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Leading and managing complex cloud migration and implementation projects
* Leveraging comprehensive knowledge of AWS services, architectures, and best practices to guide technical decisions and strategic planning
* Bridging business requirements with technical solutions, facilitating engineering discussions and ensuring alignment with customer business outcomes
* Distilling customer needs into clear technical requirements and map them to business outcomes
* Decomposing complex technical problems into actionable, deliverable solutions
* Contributing to technical documentation and define documentation standards


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences: AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture - Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth - We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance - We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in cloud computing]
* Experience in project management of technical programs
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
* Swedish language


**Preferred Qualifications**
* AWS experience preferred
* Project Management Professional (PMP) and/or AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate
* Strong understanding of AWS services, architectures, and best practices
* Experience applying AWS frameworks like Well-Architected and Cloud Adoption Framework
* Proven ability to establish technical credibility with engineering teams and senior technical decision-makers


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)

title: Enterprise Architect
company_industry: Civic and Social Organizations
description:
***Vill du vara med och forma framtidens tekniska lösningar och bidra till ett samhälle där alla får möjlighet att utvecklas? På Samhall arbetar vi dagligen för att bryta utanförskap och stärka människors möjlighet till arbete.***




  





***Nu söker vi en strategisk och driven Enterprise Architect till Stockholm/Linköping.***




  





*Kom och gör skillnad tillsammans med oss!* 




  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som Enterprise Arkitekt har du en central och strategisk roll i att utforma och förvalta företagets övergripande arkitektur. Ditt ansvar sträcker sig över samtliga arkitekturella discipliner – verksamhetsarkitektur, lösningsarkitektur, infrastrukturarkitektur, informationsarkitektur och mjukvaruarkitektur. Du arbetar aktivt med att säkerställa att företagets arkitektur stödjer våra långsiktiga mål och visioner, med ett tydligt mandat att påverka strategiska beslut.
 



  





 Du leder och samordnar arkitekturarbetet inom företaget och arbetar tillsammans med ett team av arkitekter från olika discipliner. Genom ditt strategiska perspektiv säkerställer du att arkitekturen möjliggör effektiv samverkan mellan verksamheten och IT, samt stödjer en hållbar digital transformation.
 



  





 Du samarbetar tätt med ledningsgrupper, processledare och utvecklingsteam, och du ansvarar för att arkitekturprinciper, modeller och ramverk efterlevs och utvecklas för att möta framtidens behov.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Utveckla, förvalta och kommunicera företagets övergripande arkitektur och arkitekturella strategier.
* Säkerställa att arkitekturen stödjer verksamhetens behov och strategiska mål.
* Samordna arkitekturarbetet inom samtliga arkitekturella discipliner och leda ett tvärfunktionellt team av arkitekter.
* Driva och säkerställa efterlevnad av företagets arkitekturprinciper och ramverk.
* Proaktivt identifiera och rekommendera arkitekturella förbättringar för att stödja verksamhetsutveckling och digital transformation.



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 



* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom exempelvis datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, ekonomi eller motsvarande.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet från arkitekturarbete på strategisk nivå, gärna med erfarenhet av flera arkitekturella discipliner.
* God förståelse för samspelet mellan verksamhet, processer, information och teknik.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med arkitekturramverk och strategisk arkitekturstyrning.
* Mycket god analytisk förmåga, strategiskt tänkande och kommunikativ skicklighet.



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Vi söker dig som är strategisk, kommunikativ och drivande med en stark förmåga att se helheten. Du är skicklig på att översätta komplexa arkitekturella frågor till tydliga strategiska val och lösningar. Du är en naturlig ledare, även utan personalansvar, och har lätt att skapa goda relationer och förtroende inom organisationen. Din positiva inställning, förmåga att arbeta tvärfunktionellt samt proaktivitet är viktiga framgångsfaktorer i rollen hos oss på Samhall.
 



  





**Ansökan och övrig information** 




 Vill du bli en av oss? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! På Samhall arbetar människor med många olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter, det tror vi gör oss till en mer kreativ och rolig arbetsplats. Därför söker vi alltid efter personer som på olika sätt kan bidra till att bredda våra perspektiv.
 



  





 Anställningsdatum: Enligt överenskommelse
 



 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
 



 Tjänstgöringsgrad: Heltid
 



 Befattningens placering: Stockholm/Linköping
 



 Sista ansökningsdag: 31 Maj 2025
 



  





 Kontaktpersoner: Lina Hagström HRBP via mail lina.hagstrom@samhall.se
 



 Rekryterande chef Pelle Kimvall pelle.kimvall@samhall.se
 



  





 Fackliga kontaktuppgifter:
 



 Siwerth Ahlm Unionen, 070-546 87 17
 



 Asim Zilic SACO, 070-359 45 15
 



 Linda Hinderyd, Ledarna 072–2044967
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Game Designer to Hearts of Iron
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
*As a Game Designer you will be focusing on designing and balancing engaging gameplay mechanics. Hearts of Iron, the grand strategy wargame, have over a million players monthly (and growing) expectantly waiting for what’s next for their favorite franchise.*
**Game Designer Hearts of Iron**
 We're on the lookout for a game designer driven by a passion for their craft and a fervor for crafting thrilling experiences for our players. If you're someone who finds motivation in the autonomy to lead tasks and deliver outstanding results, you're the ideal fit. Your element is a creative and collaborative space where the enthusiasm for our work is infectious, and everyone around you is not just doing a job but crafting the games we all love
 **.** 
 A keen interest in history and its narratives is a great plus.
   

  

**Your mission**
 You will be working closely with the Game Director and be the owner of the design in feature teams. Taking ownership of the designs means that you will be working hands-on from research, to design, implementation and balancing of gameplay systems. This includes being adept at communicating with your peers and colleagues in other disciplines, writing and maintaining design documents as well as testing implemented features and making sure they live up to expectations.
   

  

 Your role goes beyond crafting engaging game play - it involves actively engaging with our community, giving sneak peaks of yours & the team's latest for work as well as working closely with our marketing team to come up with the best way to showcase the game. In doing this you will be central to shaping the interaction with the people that matters most to us - our players.
   

  

**Skills That We Are Looking For**
* Solid work experience in system design
* Solid work experience in gameplay design
* Experience with scripting
* Interest in strategy/war games; PDS games in particular
* Fluency in English


 As a creative force at Paradox, you are expected to have a genuine passion for Grand Strategy Games and a good understanding of what makes them so appealing to our players.
   

  

*We will only recruit locally for this position*
 Today, Paradox consists of both publishing and internal game development. We have a broad portfolio of games and own the most important brands, including Stellaris, Europa Universalis, Hearts of Iron, Crusader Kings, Cities: Skylines, Prison Architect, Victoria, Age of Wonders and the World of Darkness catalog of brands.
   

  

 Since 2004, the company has published its games all over the world, initially through physical distribution but primarily in digital channels after 2006. Paradox games are developed primarily for PC and console platforms, but the company also releases games on mobile. The largest markets today include the US, UK, China, Germany, France and Scandinavia. In total, Paradox games have over five million players each month.

title: Global Lead - Public Safety & Critical Communications
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
*Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues both locally and around the world, reimagining what’s possible. In this role you will be part of building Public Safety & Critical Communications with deep expertise in telecom, connectivity, and mission-critical communications. We develop tailored applications and manage complex integrations to maximize the potential of technology. Join us and collaborate with the world's leading organizations to realize the full value of technology through innovative solutions.*
**The Role**
 We are seeking a Global Lead - Public Safety & Critical Communications with deep expertise in telecom, connectivity, and mission-critical communications (MCX, 5G, Edge, IoT, PMR/TETRA migration). This role requires a strategic thinker and industry thought leader with experience in public safety networks, regulatory advisory, business modelling, and telecom innovation. The ideal candidate will drive strategy, presales, delivery, and partnerships for public safety and telecom innovation projects, advising governments, enterprises, and telecom operators on mission-critical networks, spectrum strategy, and regulatory compliance. Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Public Safety & Critical Communications: Lead migration from PMR/TETRA to 4G/5G; define strategic roadmaps; drive business development; act as thought leader; develop offerings for public safety and critical communications.
* 5G & IoT Strategy: Drive 5G service offerings; advise on 5G-enabled digital manufacturing and connectivity; engage with partners; conduct assessments; provide strategy and launch guidance.
* Spectrum & Network Strategy: Advise on spectrum acquisition and valuation; define network roadmaps; develop auction strategies.
* Regulation & Compliance: Support regulatory bodies in market analysis and cost modelling; define pricing structures; advise on policy frameworks.
* Marketing & Business Strategy: Conduct technology and market analysis; develop marketing strategies; support business diversification.


**Your profile**
* 20+ years of experience in telecom, connectivity, and public safety communications.
* Proven track record in public safety and mission-critical communications projects across Europe.
* Core Competencies: Strategic analysis; mission-critical communications; spectrum strategy; 5G & IoT; program management; regulatory expertise; innovation; technico-economic analysis.
* Industry & Technical Expertise: Public safety communications; telecom infrastructure; Industry 4.0 & IoT; regulatory compliance.
* Education & Certification: bachelor’s or master’s degree in relevant fields; certifications like PMP, SAFe Agilist, ITIL, TOGAF, or regulatory compliance certifications.
* You will be required to pass through SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which is a condition of undertaking the role


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies in the telecom industry, including professional certifications in telecom technologies and BSS/OSS platforms
* Our Values: Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Freedom, Team spirit, Modesty and Fun


**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2024 global revenues of €22.1 billion.
   

  

**Get The Future You Want** 
 | www.capgemini.com

title: Business Controller
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
**Why Join Us?** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
 



 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 As Business Controller, you will be the
 **trusted advisor** 
 to our
 **Product and Development** 
 teams, optimizing financial performance across the business and ensuring financial sustainability of projects.
 



  





**Please note:** 
 This is an
 **on-site** 
 role at our office in
 **Stockholm city.** 




  





 In this role you will:
 


* Finance Business Partner for P&D: Take charge of budget creation, forecasting, and project reporting for P&D initiatives and monitor project progress with key performance indices such as ROI and Cost Performance Index (CPI).
* Product and Project Profitability: Evaluate product profitability and provide detailed financial support, including standard cost calculations, resource planning, and time-tracking for projects.
* Business Case Development: Collaborate with product management to develop and assess product business cases and inform decision-making on investments.
* Cost Control and Forecasting: Manage cost tracking and forecasts for projects, monitoring deviations and supporting accurate financial reporting.



  





**What We're Looking for:** 




 We are looking for someone that has:
 


* Equivalent of +6 years of business controlling experience, ideally within R&D or product development.
* Equivalent of bachelor's in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
* Strong financial analysis skills and business understanding, with the ability to present clear insights to senior management.
* Fluency in English (spoken and written), and a collaborative, international mindset.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), with experience using financial analysis tools such as Power BI or QlikView.



  





**Our Values:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
 



  





**What We Offer:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
 


* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Integration Lead
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
We at Maandag Nordic are now looking for a Integration Lead for our end client for an ERP implementation of Dynamics 365.
   

  

**Start:** 
 As soon as possible
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm area
   

  

**Duration:** 
 Full time until end of 2025, with possibility for extension
   

  

 Our client is an international organization that makes both products for the B2B and D2C market. We are looking for an Integration lead / Project leader who will lead the build and integration all want between Dynamics 365 and other systems. You will be responsible for the end to end coordination of the process. You will pick up the process from the architect and consultants and align it with the key end users and ultimately coordinate the design to solution.
   

  

**Key tasks:**
* End to end coordination of Azure integration layer
* Project management: Optimal steering and bringing together the various teams (developers (external party), architects and key users)
* Making efficiencies in integrations and taking things out where necessary. Very important to stay lean!


**Job requirements**
 To be successful in this role, we see that you have the following areas of experience:
   

  

* Demonstrated experience of guiding integration projects as a coordinator, project leader or integration lead
* Previously coordinated integration projects with Azure Integration layer
* Demonstrable experience of guiding integrations in Dynamics 365
* Fluent in English both written and verbal (Swedish is a plus but not a must)


**Nice To Have**
* Experience in the retail sector to have a good understanding of the business and the systems being interfaced with


**Application procedure**
 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   

  

**About The Company**
 Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
   

  

 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: Analytisk Biokemist
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
**Om tjänsten**
 QRIOS Life Science & Engineering söker nu flera analytiska biokemister för ett spännande och utvecklande uppdrag hos vår kund AstraZeneca. Uppdraget är placerat på deras toppmoderna produktionsanläggning Sweden Biomanufacturing Center (SBC) i Södertälje – en central del av AstraZenecas strategi för produktion av biologiska läkemedel.
   

  

 Som konsult hos QRIOS får du en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal, goda förmåner och stora möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Du blir samtidigt en viktig del i ett av världens ledande life science-företag där du får bidra till att forma framtidens läkemedel.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter i huvudsak**
 Som analytisk biokemist inom kvalitetskontroll på SBC arbetar du med avancerade analyser enligt gällande cGxP. Arbetet innefattar:
   

  

* Provhantering, beredning av prover och reagenser
* Utförande av analyser med tekniker som HPSEC, GC, CE-SDS, gelelektrofores, cIEF, UV/Vis
* Devicetestning och kompendiala analyser (t.ex. utseende, synliga partiklar, extraherbar volym)
* Dataanalys, granskning och rapportering av resultat
* Metodöverföring (ATT), trendanalyser och analytiskt stöd till processvalideringar
* Underhåll av laboratorieutrustning samt administrativa uppgifter
* Deltagande i LEAN-arbete och förbättringsinitiativ
* Du arbetar i ett tvärfunktionellt team med både lokala och globala kontaktytor.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har
   

  

* En naturvetenskaplig utbildning inom kemi, biokemi eller motsvarande (minst 180 hp)
* Praktisk erfarenhet av analytiskt laboratoriearbete, gärna inom GMP-styrd miljö
* Vana vid att arbeta med kvalitetskontroll, gärna i läkemedels- eller livsmedelsindustrin
* God kommunikationsförmåga i både svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift
* Meriterande är erfarenhet av LEAN-arbete, samt tidigare arbete med kvalitetsprocesser inom reglerade verksamheter.


 Du är en strukturerad, noggrann och analytisk person med ett öga för detaljer. Du trivs med att ta eget ansvar samtidigt som du samarbetar tätt med andra. Flexibilitet och förmåga att hantera förändrade förutsättningar är viktiga egenskaper i rollen.
   

  

**Om verksamheten**
 QRIOS Life Science & Engineering är ett konsultbolag med fokus på kompetens inom teknik, naturvetenskap och IT. Vi erbjuder kvalificerade konsulttjänster till företag inom bland annat läkemedel, bioteknik, medicinteknik och livsmedel. Hos oss arbetar erfarna och passionerade specialister som drivs av att lösa komplexa utmaningar och bidra till ett bättre samhälle.
   

  

 AstraZeneca är ett globalt, innovationsdrivet biofarmaceutiskt företag med fokus på forskning, utveckling och tillverkning av läkemedel. Deras anläggning i Södertälje är en av världens största och mest avancerade inom läkemedelsproduktion, och på Sweden Biomanufacturing Center (SBC) sker produktion av biologiska läkemedel med hjälp av den senaste teknologin och i en kultur som präglas av innovation, kvalitet och hållbarhet.
   

  

 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Urval sker löpande.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig konsultchef, Robert Nabel på QRIOS.
   

  

**Fakta**
* Bransch


 Life Science
   

  

* Stad Södertälje
* Anställningsform Tillsvidareanställning
* Uppdragstyp Heltid
* Sista ansökningsdag 2025-05-31
* Referensnummer 1263


**Har du frågor?**
 Robert Nabel

title: Commercial Business Controller
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

 We are currently looking for a
 **Commercial** 
**Business Controller** 
 for the Commercial function in Europe APMEA.
   

  

**About The Role:**
 In a dynamic and fast-moving environment, you will act as a financial advisor by providing decision making support and business intelligence for the Commercial function in Europe APMEA.
   

  

 You will be part of the BA EA Finance Leadership Team and the European Commercial Leadership Team and report operationally to CFO BA EA and functionally to SVP Commercial EU.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
**Finance Business Partnership:**
* Provide financial leadership to the Commercial Areas by adding value in taking strategic and operational business decisions
* Ensure understanding, communication and implementation of the financial and business strategy in the Extended Commercial EU Leadership Team and within the CA Controllers
* Ensure high quality, transparency and integrity of the financial information and management report


**Business Planning & Performance Management:**
* Contribute to build, deploy and monitor budget process in the overall Commercial organization
* Ensure business visibility on Weekly, Monthly basis through solid governance model
* Responsible for the price strategy, definitions and governance.
* Responsible for Price & Revenue Management including Volume, Price and Mix calculation/management.
* Provide financial inputs and analysis of different scenarios, new initiatives, etc., in order to support the sales decision process.
* Build, track and report financial KPIs in Commercial organization
* Collaboration with Financial Controlling to secure proper procedures are in place and followed-up


**Finance Leadership to Commercial Area Controlling:**
* Ensure functional skills development for direct and functional reports across the Commercial Finance organization
* Ensure effective governance forums within the controlling teams to enable smooth collaboration and efficient ways of working
* Work closely with Commercial EU Leadership Team, BA EA Finance Leadership Team and BA/Group Finance to ensure strong collaboration and support for the Commercial finance function, talent management and capability building


 You will additionally be responsible for different expertise areas that contribute to the Commercial P&L, such as Credit Management, Pricing Office, Marketing Controlling and Business Market Intelligence.
   

  

**Requirements:**
* Effective Communication: You set clear objectives and direction for others. You clarify prioritizations and can interact with different functions and levels within the company.
* Strategic Capability: You translate the business needs into priorities to drive results, and deploy it with speed
* Agility: Both reactive and proactive, you work efficiently and flexibly to deliver results
* Analytics: You have the ability to interpret complex data. You can translate data into meaningful, useful information that steers effective decision-making. You are digitally savvy and can work seamlessly with new tools and technology.
* Collaboration: You ask and you listen, you take ideas on board and work with your team, taking everyone in the same direction.
* Finance and Leadership Experience: You are a seasoned finance leader with strong skills and ability to motivate, grow and develop your team. You have worked in complex regional finance management teams, influenced stakeholders and steered performance across the business.


**Where you'll be situated:**
 You will be based at our Global headquarters in Stockholm at Sankt Göransgatan 143
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment,
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path,
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services,
* Family, health and wellbeing benefits,
* Insurance policy plan,
* Additional holidays.


**Find out more:**
 Electrolux Group: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux
   

  

 Stockholm HQ: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/sweden

title: Client Director
company_industry: Software Development
description:
**Help organizations treat knowledge like the business-critical asset it is.** 




  





**About Learnster** 




 At Learnster, we partner with forward-thinking organizations who want more than just a learning system. We work with companies that view knowledge as infrastructure – and understand that solving learning challenges requires more than technology. It requires strategy, partnership, and business alignment.
 



 Learnster is a fast-growing SaaS learning platform and AI-powered solution used by hundreds of thousands of users in over 30 countries. We are now strengthening our Sales team with a Client Director who thrives in leading complex, strategic dialogues and guide customers toward impactful, business-aligned learning initiatives.
 



  





**Your Mission** 




 As Client Director, your mission is to identify and win over organizations where learning and knowledge are central to growth, performance, and scalability. Instead of focusing on a single vertical, you’ll target a defined set of industries and business models where Learnster creates the most value – typically mid- to large-sized companies with:
 



  





 - Distributed teams or partner networks
 



 - Growing service or advisory organizations
 



 - Regulatory demands and compliance complexity
 



 - A strong need to align onboarding, up-skilling, and knowledge sharing with business goals
 



  





 In these organizations, you’ll meet stakeholders who are looking for more than a system. They are looking for a long-term partner to help them orchestrate knowledge as a strategic capability
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 




 - Drive the full sales cycle – from proactive outreach to signed partnerships.
 



 - Lead high-impact conversations with C-level, HR, Operations, and Business Unit leaders.
 



 - Position Learnster as a strategic knowledge partner – not just another tech vendor.
 



 - Build strong business cases that link learning initiatives to measurable business outcomes.
 



 - Prioritize high-potential accounts using insights from our proven GTM playbooks.
 



 - Partner closely with Marketing, Customer Success, and Product to create momentum across the buyer journey.
 



  





**You Might Be a Fit If You…** 




 - Have 4–6+ years of experience in complex B2B SaaS sales.
 



 - Are skilled in value-based selling and consultative dialogue – not just delivering presentations.
 



 - Know how to guide customers from “learning need” to “business impact”.
 



 - Thrive in conversations with HR and L&D, while always staying focused on the business case.
 



 - Can confidently lead whiteboard sessions with C-level stakeholders – and ask the right questions.
 



 - Are fluent in both Swedish and English.
 



  





**We’re especially interested in candidates who:** 




 - Have experience selling into people-driven organizations (e.g., advisory firms, service companies, regulated industries).
 



 - Are passionate about organizational development, knowledge sharing, or business transformation.
 



 - Combine strategic thinking with strong commercial drive.
 



  





  





**What We Expect** 




 We set a high bar – and we’re looking for someone who does too. In this role, you are expected to:
 



 - Deliver results – not just activity. You take full ownership of your targets and are relentless in achieving them.
 



 - Create your own momentum. You don’t wait for leads – you proactively open doors and build strong opportunities. 
 



 - Excel in consultative sales. You lead value-driven conversations, ask the right questions, and know how to connect learning needs into business impact.
 



 - Move with urgency and structure. You maintain momentum in every buyer conversation, and surprises are rare because your pipeline and forecast are solid.
 



 - Show up with ambition and ownership. You represent Learnster with professionalism in every interaction and bring a self-starting mindset to everything you do.
 



 - Seek growth and challenge. You’re not here to stay comfortable – you want to be pushed, grow, and win.
 



  





  





**What We Offer** 




 - A chance to work at the forefront of the Knowledge Orchestration movement.
 



 - A meaningful role where your conversations influence how companies grow, scale, and adapt through knowledge.
 



 - A high-performing team, a modern go-to-market approach, and a product recognized as one of the Top 10 Learning Systems of 2024 by Craig Weiss.
 



 - A strong brand presence, proven outbound strategy, and structured value programs – all designed to support your success.
 



 - A hybrid work setup with modern offices in the heart of Stockholm (Malmskillnadsgatan 32).
 



 - An ambitious, collaborative culture that values ownership, experimentation, and shared wins
 



 - Opportunities for personal growth and career development in a fast-scaling international SaaS company.
 



  





  





**What Makes Learnster Unique** 




 At Learnster, we don’t just sell features – we solve real business challenges. We work with companies that:
 



  





 - Understand that technology alone isn’t the answer to learning challenges.
 



 - Want to connect knowledge initiatives with measurable business outcomes.
 



 - Seek a long-term partner to support operational development and lasting impact.
 



  





 Our product and approach reflect that commitment. One clear example is Learnster Orchestrator – a unique module that empowers business and knowledge leaders to co-create initiatives that align directly with company goals. It’s how we turn strategy into action – and knowledge into results.
 



  





**Interested?** 




  





 Send us your CV or LinkedIn profile. If you believe learning should have a seat at the business table, you might be exactly who we’re looking for.
 



 Let’s turn knowledge into business impact. Together.

title: Logistics Executive
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
**Join us to deliver a smoke- free future as Logistics Executive!**
 We’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future. Swedish Match is an affiliate of PMI and have been a leader in the industry for more than 200 years.
   

  

 In the Nordic region, we are 1,600 employees based in Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Norway working in various functions and teams and together we are collaborating to deliver a smoke-free Nordics.
   

  

 Are you ready to take up the challenge of being in the heart of business, to experience the adrenaline boost of meeting those unnegotiable daily goals, and to feel the vibe when you and the team – against all odds – succeed? If so, then please continue reading!
   

  

 In our Service Delivery Team, we have the mission to handle the entire fulfillment flow to market and the distribution to its customers and consumers in order to fulfill internal and external customers’ expectations and align with all laws and regulations. We contribute to building a unique consumer experience of our multi-category product portfolio by guaranteeing adequate product availability across multiple distribution channels, demonstrating contemporary and new solutions to reach outstanding levels.
   

  

 As a Logistics Executive, you will drive all outbound activities from the Logistics Service Provider (LSP) towards consumers. You will collaborate closely with key counterparts both locally and internationally, maintaining a focus on your customers. Additionally, you will cooperate in future-shaping projects both at a local and EU level.
   

  

**Your Day-to-day**
* Monitoring shipments from the factory to the LSP for the Nordic markets.
* Managing customer and B2C forward orders and their deliveries and reverse flows; guaranteeing cost-efficient and timely fulfillment and reverse process to market and its customers/consumers.
* Managing relationships with LSPs, contract conditions, ensuring compliance with audit and internal billing guidelines, and participating in tender processes with Procurement.
* Regular monitoring of Track and Trace reporting and compliance.
* Looking for process improvements, productivities, and sustainability initiatives.
* Customer collaboration activities such as analyzing order patterns and improving the return process.
* Developing procedures for logistics processes such as stock counts and destructions.
* Shaping the logistics landscape to deliver our transformation towards a smoke-free future.


**Who We’re Looking For**
* 2-3 years of experience in the field of supply chain in an internationally operating (FMCG) company.
* Knowledgeable and passionate about the Logistics, Sales & Distribution environment.
* Advanced knowledge of MS Office (SAP knowledge is a plus).
* Proficiency in English with good general communication skills.


**Key Competencies**
* You are a problem solver and versatile.
* You are resilient in a dynamically changing environment.
* You have a high team orientation but are also able to work independently.
* You are open and courageous for new things and have the will to optimize.
* You are able to quickly establish excellent contacts with our internal and external customers.
* You have a high degree of analytical and learning capabilities, including a high level of quality of work.


 All applicants must have the legal right to work in Sweden. Relocation support is not available for this job.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Our success depends on the people who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join Swedish Match and you too can:
   

  

* Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment, and explore.
* Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
* Enjoy the flexibility of a hybrid way of working - split your time between working from our office or the comfort of your home, where it works best for you in line with business needs.
* Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provide endless opportunities to progress.
* Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future.


 #SWMA
