title: Senior Android Engineer
company_industry: Software Development
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 


* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv
 **with high ambitions.**



  





**We in the Messaging team** 
 own everything under the messaging domain at Truecaller - building, transforming, and optimizing existing and new features to make messaging more reliable and secure for our users. With over 400 million users, we operate one of the world's largest Instant Messaging (IM) services.
 



  





**As a Senior Android Engineer within the messaging team,** 
 you will play a key role in building and enhancing core messaging features integral to our product. You'll work closely with a talented team of Android engineers, writing high-quality, maintainable code while ensuring optimal performance and user experience. Collaboration is at the heart of this role, as you'll partner with various teams and roles across the company to align with shared objectives and contribute to the broader product vision. By following best practices and upholding high engineering standards, you'll help drive the success of our platform, making a meaningful impact while growing in a dynamic and supportive environment.
 



  





**The impact you will create:** 




* Collaborate with product managers, data analysts, designers, and engineers to build & A/B test new features using Agile methodology.
* Identify & execute large tech excellence initiatives to improve code quality & health.
* Take responsibility for setting & maintaining high engineering standards and commitment to building products that meet user needs.
* Share knowledge & drive the adoption of best practices for Android engineering at Truecaller.



  





**What you bring in:** 




* 8+ years of experience in Android development.
* A strong passion for enhancing user experiences and contributing to product roadmap.
* Solid understanding of the Android SDK.
* Experience with RESTful APIs.
* Proficiency in Kotlin, Coroutines, and Dependency Injection.
* Strong knowledge of version control tools, such as Git.
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 



* Strong knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices, as well as an eye for design.
* Interest in mentoring & coaching others.



  





**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/** 




  





**Sounds like your dream job?** 




 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



  





**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




  





 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
 



  





**What we offer:** 



* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package** 
 : Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!



  





**Come as you are:** 




 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.**

title: Machine Learning Engineer | AI Foundations
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
**About The Team**
 Schibsted's AI Foundations team is looking for a machine learning engineer to help advance AI across the company, facilitating AI experiments and development.
   

  

 Located in Sweden and Norway, the team is responsible for building and maintaining core AI infrastructure and ML platform services for the company, as well as supporting the development of AI models and solutions. We collaborate with many other parts of the organisation to enable new AI initiatives, including experiment teams, product development, security & privacy, as well as journalists.
   

  

 What will you do in this role?
   

  

 You’ll play an important role in shaping our AI platform offering. Specifically, you will:
   

  

* Work together with product teams to develop and augment our vector store products to serve article, podcast, video, or user embeddings for personalisation and search.
* Partner with AI experiment and data infrastructure teams to develop LLM agents, RAG solutions and other pipelines that interact with our own data products
* Develop and deploy novel models for Schibsted's recommender systems, text-to-speech or video.
* Monitor, maintain, and build out our hybrid infrastructure to serve internal (LLM, RL, etc.) models cost-effectively.
* Refine our batch ML workload orchestration platform together with our users.
* Develop self-serve API solutions for accessing external LLM providers and internal LLM endpoints.
* Support experimentation and testing of new AI solutions facing millions of users (e.g., Hej Aftonbladet).
* Contribute to AI operations: setting up dashboards and alerts for our infrastructure and models.
* Contribute to a shared understanding of ML/AI knowledge and expertise and promote machine learning literacy across the company.
* Challenge and inspire the team by staying current with the latest advancements in machine learning and related technologies.


 What we’re looking for
   

  

 You bring a strong engineering mindset, a structured approach to problem-solving, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional stakeholders. More specifically, you have:
   

  

* 2-5 years of proven experience as a machine learning engineer, or equivalent.
* Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field.
* Solid understanding of machine learning lifecycle and fundamentals, and are up-to-date with recent LLM advancements.
* Expertise in Python.
* Familiarity with common development tools like GitHub and GitHub Actions, Copilot.
* Passion for delivering products with a great developer experience.
* A clear and compelling communication style - able to translate complex engineering solutions to non-technical audiences, including journalists.


 Bonus qualifications:
   

  

* Experience with embedding models, and/or vector stores such as Vespa or Weaviate.
* Experience with training (Pytorch) and serving LLM models, generative AI, and RAG applications.
* Comfortable working with multi-cloud setup and experience with AWS and/or GCP and containerised environments like Kubernetes in combination with Terraform.
* Experience working in media, content, or digital product environments.


 Our tech stack:
   

  

* Cloud infrastructure: Hybrid AWS/GCP, Kubernetes
* CI/CD: Terraform, Github Actions
* Model serving: Triton Inference Server, vLLM
* Vector/Feature serving: Vespa, Tecton
* Workload orchestration: Flyte, Ray
* LLM access: OpenWebUI, LiteLLM
* Monitoring & alerting: Grafana
* Coding: Python, HCL, Javascript/Typescript


 Why we enjoy working here:
   

  

 At Schibsted, we value openness, curiosity, and collaboration. You’ll be part of a diverse, inclusive workplace that encourages bold thinking and continuous learning. Our work directly supports public interest journalism—and we take that responsibility seriously.
   

  

 Our engineering culture is built on trust and autonomy. You’ll have significant freedom to choose your tools, influence how we work, and explore the technologies you find most compelling. Whether you're passionate about advancing LLM architectures, refining ML Ops pipelines, or diving into new AI tools and frameworks, we support continuous learning and specialization.

title: Data Engineer - Sportsbook
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
 We’re looking for a skilled and motivated Data Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this crucial role, you will be instrumental in fostering a data-driven culture across our organisation, enabling departments to leverage data comprehensively and facilitating data teams in building models, AI, and machine learning solutions.
   

  

 Your expertise will drive the development and maintenance of our state-of-the-art cloud-based data platform, which is central to powering our globally recognized brand. In this role, you will see a direct correlation between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Build and maintain highly scalable and robust data management systems tailored to specific business needs and challenges.
* Ensure systems meet business requirements and industry practices for data integrity, security, and accessibility.
* Build, maintain, develop, test, deploy and enhance our data pipelines and systems
* Collaborate with data team and stakeholders including data architects, Executive and Product from the beginning to the delivery of a project
* Ensure the highest quality of data is made available throughout the entire organisation and systems meeting our SLAs


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 ESSENTIAL SKILLS:
   

  

* Experience working in an online, gaming, or fast-moving industry
* 3+ years of work experience in data engineers and data platforms
* Must have experience in successfully implementing data-centric applications, such as data warehouses, operational data stores, and data integration projects
* Experience with SQL, ETL, data modelling, and Python
* Proven experience with Bigquery
* Proficient with one or more big data & new data technologies such as DBT, Apache NiFi, Airflow, Kafka


 NICE TO HAVES:
   

  

* Experience from the iGaming industry is meriting


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices world-wide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Fullstackutvecklare
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Fullstackutvecklare till Qlocx AB, Stockholm** 




  





 På Qlocx utvecklar vi hela ekosystemet för smarta, obemannade leveranser – från robust hårdvara till skalbara mjukvaruplattformar. Våra system används redan i tusentals paketboxar i fält och är integrerade med några av de största logistikaktörerna i Europa. Vi bygger allt in-house – API:er, embedded-system, infrastruktur och användargränssnitt – och vi gör det med målet att skapa pålitliga, hållbara och moderna lösningar för framtidens logistik.
 



  
 



 Vill du arbeta i ett produktbolag där din kod inte bara körs – utan också öppnar dörrar, levererar paket och driver verklig förändring? Då kan detta vara rätt utmaning för dig.
 








**Om rollen:** 




  





 Som Fullstackutvecklare hos oss kommer du att arbeta med hela stacken – från frontend till backend och databas. Du kommer att vara involverad i utvecklingen av webbapplikationer och backendlösningar. Start sker så snart som möjligt och tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm.
 








**Ansvarsområden:** 



* Utveckling och underhåll av våra frontend -applikationer byggda i
 **React**
* Server- och API-utveckling i
 **Node.js** 
 ,
 **Express** 
 ,
 **Koa** 
  och
 **NestJS**
* Databasdesign och optimering med
 **MongoDB** 
  (inklusive aggregeringar och indexering)
* Designa och underhålla våran molninfrastruktur på
 **AWS**
* Jobba tillsammans med våra kunder för att designa, dokumentera och kommunicera tekniska lösningar



**Kravprofil:** 



* God erfarenhet av alla vardera delar i MERN-stacken:
 **MongoDB, Express/Koa, React, Node.js**
* God erfarenhet av att deploya och underhålla infrastruktur på
 **AWS**
* Erfarenhet av, och kan uttrycka, en tydlig vision om hur ett bra
 **CD/CI** 
 ska se ut
* Vana av att arbeta agilt och iterativt i
 **sprintar** 
  där hantering av scopet och leverans är viktigt
* Erfarenhet av andra programmeringsspråk, såsom Java, Swift, C, Python eller annat



**Personliga egenskaper:** 



* Problemlösningsorienterad och analytisk
* Självgående med stark samarbetsförmåga
* Strukturerad och noggrann
* Lyhörd och kommunikativ i en team-miljö där teknik diskuteras i både hög och låg nivå



  
 



**Ansökan:** 




 Skicka din ansökan och CV snarast möjligt då urval sker löpande. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta oss på info@qlocx.com.
 



 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Co-Founding CTO
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Management
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
Ready to build your startup and get funded in 10 weeks? We’re a global early-stage VC backing founders from day zero. We invest up to €400k through our founder residency – a building sprint where you leverage community, sparring, and intense effort to make 1 year of progress in 10 weeks.
 



  





**About Antler** 




  





 Join the next Nordics residency starting
 **September 1st, 2025, in Stockholm** 
 . Build your company alongside a cohort of pre-vetted, exceptional potential co-founders, validate your ideas, engage with customers, develop your MVP, refine your business model, and create your go-to-market strategy before pitching to the investment committee.
 



  





**Who Makes a Great Technical Founder?** 




  





 As a technical founder, your expertise in software engineering, AI/ML, data science, or deep tech will be critical in building and scaling a venture-backed startup. You might be:
 



  




* A CTO or senior engineering leader ready to transition from building for others to founding your own company.
* A deep tech or AI/ML expert with a vision for how emerging technologies can solve critical problems.
* A full-stack or backend engineer eager to take ownership of a product from zero to one.
* A technical architect or hands-on builder who thrives on solving complex technical challenges at scale.



  





**Founder DNA: What Sets You Apart?** 




  





 Beyond technical ability, the best startup CTOs have:
 



  




* Inner drive – You have a vision for what you want to build and the ambition to execute.
* Creative problem-solving – You don’t just code; you build scalable systems and innovative solutions.
* Grit – You thrive in uncertainty, iterate quickly, and push through technical and business challenges.



  





**The Antler Founder Residency:** 




 The residency starts on
 **September 1st, 2025,** 
 and runs for
 **10 weeks** 
 ,
 **full-time** 
 ,
 **in-person in Stockholm** 
 . Any adjustments have to be agreed to in the interview process.
 



 Our residency program is fairly unstructured, with 90%+ of the time focused dedicated to founders working on their companies and making week-over-week progress. Here are some examples of things that founders focus on, depending on where they are at in their company journey:
 



  




* Find and vet potential cofounders
* Validate core assumptions around your business ideas and find meaningful market insight
* Build prototypes, find design partners, launch pilots, close customers
* Get feedback from functional experts and dedicated coaches
* Reach milestones that align with pre-seed funding



  





 If founders have already accomplished any of the above, they dedicate their full effort on the next most important milestones.
 



  





**Antler Investment Process** 



* At the end of the 10-week residency, you will have the opportunity to present to the Antler Investment Committee. If approved by the investment committee, you will receive a pre-seed commitment of
 **€400,000** 
 in two tranches. €100k for 10% and €300k in follow-on capital.
* Companies that receive investment at the end of the residency will join the Antler portfolio and gain even higher touch programming from our partners. This includes access our network of downstream investors, integration into the Antler Nordics portfolio and global portfolio network, and introductions to relevant partners and discounted service providers.



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is a early-stage VC that is changing the way people build companies. We operate in 30 locations worldwide, have supported 8,000+ founders through our residencies, and invested in 1500+ startups globally. We launched Antler to build a better on-ramp to venture capital. After working in venture-backed companies for years, we built Antler to provide founders with a structured and transparent process to successfully launch a new venture, a community for support throughout the experience, and a clear pathway to venture funding.
 



  





**Antler Highlights:** 




 Some examples of successful companies that were built as a result of Antler’s residency, received pre-seed investment from Antler, and have gone on to raise substantial investments are as follows:
 


* **Airalo:** 
 The world’s first eSIM subscription and top-up store
* **Wingbits** 
 : Incentive-based flight tracking platform
* **Treyd:** 
 Working capital operating system for B2B
* **Reebelo:** 
 Used electronics marketplace
* **Telgea:** 
 Global telecom operator
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software for identifying the best solar sites faster



  





**Cohort starts: September 1st, 2025, but we're working with founders all year round on an ad hoc basis.** 




  





**APPLY NOW**

title: Programmerare inom AV
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
Är du en teknikdriven och lösningsorienterad person med specialistkompetens inom Crestron-programmering? Vill du arbeta med några av Sveriges mest avancerade AV-lösningar och bidra till utvecklingen av framtidens digitala mötesrum? Då erbjuder vi på Atea en spännande roll för dig som vill ta nästa steg i karriären - där du får möjlighet att påverka både din egen och vår gemensamma utveckling.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som Crestronprogrammerare hos oss får du en central roll i att utveckla och implementera styrsystemslösningar. Du arbetar tätt tillsammans med projektledare, tekniker och lösningsarkitekter för att säkerställa att våra leveranser håller hög kvalitet - både tekniskt och användarmässigt.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna inkluderar:
   

  

 Programmering och konfiguration av Crestron-system (t.ex. SIMPL+, C#).
   

  

 Testning, driftsättning och felsökning, både på distans och på plats hos kund.
   

  

 Utveckling av interna ramverk och återanvändbara moduler.
   

  

 Deltagande i hela leveransprocessen - från teknisk förstudie till färdig driftsättning.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du har en god teknisk förståelse och erfarenhet av att arbeta med Crestron-programmering. Du är strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och har ett starkt intresse för att skapa tydliga, pålitliga och användarvänliga gränssnitt.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du:
   

  

 Har tidigare erfarenhet av programmering i Crestron-miljöer och är bekväm med styrsystem som en del av komplexa AV-lösningar.
   

  

 Trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team, och känner dig trygg i en kundnära roll.
   

  

 Har god förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett tydligt sätt.
   

  

 Bor i
 **Stockholm, Uppsala eller i närliggande område** 
 . Du kommer utgå från kontoret, med resor till kund vid behov inom regionen.
   

  

**Om Atea**
 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av IT-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.
   

  

 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" - en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
   

  

**Kontakt & mer information**
 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Erik Hansson, Konsultchef, via erik.a.hansson@atea.se . Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.
   

  

 Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
   

  

 Atea vill vara The Place To Be och därför värdesätter vi de kvalitéer som en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Senior Data Engineer – Stockholm
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, TV channels and production studios. We believe in the power of content not just to tell stories and touch lives, but to expand worlds.
   

  

 We are looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we are searching for a
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 to join our Stockholm office. Ready to hit play on an exciting career move?
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 As a
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 , you will be a key technical leader within our data engineering team. Working closely with product, analytics and commercial teams, you will help shape our data architecture and drive the evolution of our data platform. Our stack is hosted in AWS Cloud and supports both batch and real-time data pipelines. You will take ownership of building scalable systems using Spark (Scala/Java), Lambda and Flink, and set the standard for engineering excellence.
   

  

 You will also play a central role in mentoring peers, guiding architectural decisions and championing best practices across the team.
   

  

 What You Will Be Doing
   

  

* Architect, develop and maintain robust, scalable data pipelines
* Influence and evolve our data infrastructure and platform strategy
* Ensure the quality, performance and reliability of our data products
* Collaborate cross-functionally to align data solutions with business needs
* Champion clean code, testing, observability and peer review practices
* Lead by example and support the growth of less experienced engineers


 What We Are Looking For
   

  

 To succeed in this role, you should bring at least
 **5 years of professional experience in data engineering** 
 , with
 **2 or more years in a senior-level role** 
 where you led technical decision-making or complex initiatives.
   

  

**Role**
 We value curiosity, humility and a passion for solving complex problems. While you may not tick every box, here is what we think will set someone up for success in this role:
   

  

* Solid experience building distributed data pipelines using Spark
* Strong programming skills in Scala or Java (Python is a plus)
* Deep understanding of cloud infrastructure, ideally AWS
* Experience with data streaming technologies such as Flink and Lambda
* Strong knowledge of data modelling, versioning and orchestration tools
* A holistic mindset, understanding the wider impact of engineering choices
* Proven ability to mentor others, lead technical discussions and influence architecture


 Bonus If You Have
   

  

* Experience with infrastructure as code and CI/CD pipelines
* A focus on developer experience, platform thinking or data quality frameworks
* Contributions to open-source or internal tech communities


**Our offering** 
  

  

* We have got the basics covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year and extra compensation on top of a parental pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We have an attractive pension and insurance scheme with full health care coverage should you need it.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill with the freedom to try new things in autonomous teams. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development, while always making sure you feel supported with regular knowledge-sharing sessions, technical training, mentorship opportunities and peer-to-peer networks.
* An innovative environment with yearly Hack Days. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* A genuinely international and diverse group of colleagues to connect with. We’re striving towards a 50:50 gender balance & we’re not far off – plus last time we checked, we have more than 60 different nationalities across our nine offices!
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including live sports & pay per view events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Principle Engineer for Planning of New Power System Solutions
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, Non-profit Organizations, and Government Administration
description:
**Your mission**
* Analyze trends in the development of new power systems to shape the vision for relevant technologies, platforms, and industry directions. Establish and guide long-term technical development strategies for the product portfolio.
* Integrate insights from emerging technologies like BESS, FACTS, and customer pain points to create cutting-edge and market-leading new power system solutions.
* Perform Joint-Innovation activities with internal and external partners


 Execute simulations, power system studies, and support field testing with internal and external stakeholders within joint-Innovation projects
   

  

* Active and influential participation in academic or industrial standardization organizations, holding key technical leadership roles and contributing to industry advancement.


**Core Competency Requirements**
* Deep understanding of the evolution of new power system solutions and platform architectures, like BESS, FACTS, HVDC, MVDC etc. Ability to anticipate customer needs and address challenges across diverse operational scenarios.
* Mastery of new power systems, photovoltaics, energy storage, or EV charging infrastructure. Proven ability to drive continuous innovation and breakthroughs in key areas such as grid-forming inverters (GFM), grid simulation, virtual power plants, and advanced energy storage
* Industry-wide vision with the capability to identify trends, integrate leading technologies, and apply multi-dimensional thinking (cross-domain, customer value, ecosystem collaboration) to translate innovation into competitive products. Hands-on experience in power system product or platform development, especially in the area of renewable sources integration
* Successful Implementation of Key Technologies Solid experience in bringing critical technologies and projects to fruition. Ability to identify and solve customer pain points, with a track record of influencing executive-level technical decisions.
* Ideally, you bring experience in power systems control for power electronic inverters
* Structured way of working, initiative, creativity, ability to work in a team, communication skills, motivation as well as enthusiasm and quality orientation
* Fluent in written and spoken English (working language).
